byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren reported from Jerusalem, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations. Majd Al Waheidi contributed reporting from Gaza.
byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN and SOMINI SENGUPTA

abstract: United Nations Commission of Inquiry report faults both Israel and Palestinians for violating international law in 2014 Gaza War; Israelis condemn report as evidence of UN bias against them while Hamas dismisses condemnation of its own actions and says report supports prosecution of Israel in International Criminal Court.
lead_paragraph: The report said “impunity prevails across the board” regarding the actions of Israeli forces in Gaza, but also cited the “inherently indiscriminate nature” of rockets fired at Israeli civilians.

headline.main: U.N. Report on Gaza Finds Evidence of War Crimes by Israel and by Palestinian Militants
headline.print_headline: Both Sides in Gaza War Are Faulted by U.N. Panel

snippet: The report said “impunity prevails across the board” regarding the actions of Israeli forces in Gaza, but also cited the “inherently indiscriminate nature” of rockets fired at Israeli civilians.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
